plugins.name: Pixel Magic
plugins.description:
Transform your images into eye-catching pixel art with Pixel, the ultimate Figma plugin for pixel enthusiasts! Whether you're crafting retro aesthetics or exploring unique design styles, Pixie offers endless possibilities for creativity.


Why Use Pixel Pixie?

  1. Custom Backgrounds: Set your own background color to complement your design perfectly.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Control size for the ideal level of detail in your artwork.
  3. Pixel Shapes: Choose from various pixel shapes (squares, circles, and semi-circle) to customize your pixel art style.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export the pixelated effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for designers, artists, and creative minds, Pixie lets you reimagine your visuals in stunning pixelated forms. Discover how this versatile plugin can bring a bold new dimension to your designs.


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome üôè


Contact:

Email: astroashvi@gmail.com

X/Twitter: https://x.com/HarshithAshvi

plugins.name: Cloudinary
plugins.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary‚Äôs powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.

plugins.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
plugins.description:
cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
plugins.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

Broken Variable Finder scans the current page, or a section of your choice, in your Figma document and identifies any nodes that are connected to deleted variables or missing variable collections:


  1. üé® Color variables (fills, strokes, effects, backgrounds)
  2. üî† Text variables (text content, font family, font size, line height, etc.)
  3. üìê Layout variables (gap, padding, width, height, corner radius, etc.)

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ‚ÄùGenerate Keywords‚Äù and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I‚Äôd love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: Airtable Connect
plugins.description:
The plugin allows data from Airtable to be mapped to the layers of Figma components. This functionality is especially useful for designers looking to streamline their workflow and maximize efficiency. With this plugin, it is possible to generate multiple design variations in a matter of seconds, eliminating the need for manual adjustments one by one.


By integrating Airtable with Figma, designers can import structured data directly into their design files. For example, if you have a table in Airtable with different content versions for a marketing campaign, you can assign this data to text and image elements in your Figma components. This not only saves time but also reduces the risk of errors when copying and pasting information.


Furthermore, the plugin is highly versatile and can be used in a variety of projects, from creating user interface prototypes to generating personalized graphic material. Its intuitive use does not require advanced knowledge, making it accessible to both beginner and experienced designers.


In summary, this plugin transforms the way we work with data and design, providing an efficient and effective solution for creating dynamic and adaptable designs.


https://airtable-connect.livingcrowdland.com/
plugins.tagline: The plugin maps Airtable data to Figma layers, enabling quick creation of multiple design variations

plugins.name: Automator: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.
plugins.description:
Want to create hundreds of creatives instantly? Well now you can!


Introducing Automator, a plugin built to make executing multiple creatives quick and easy.


How does it work?

Automator takes your existing creatives within Figma and applies data to that creative from a spreadsheet. You can simply drag your spreadsheet of data into Automator and it will convert that data into creatives. The only thing you need to do is make sure that your item names match the headers in your spreadsheet. The data can consist of text and images (note that images need to be served from a URL).


For best results make sure that you have you prepared your 'template' creatives in a way that work best for your data. Make sure that your text boxes are sized in a way that the new text can fit, such as keeping the box boundaries within the creative space. Automator automatically resizes the text to fit the text box, so keep that in mind when it comes to text that you don't want to be larger than a button or text that goes over an focal point of an image.
plugins.tagline: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.

plugins.name: D2C Tokenizer
plugins.description:

If the connection are not established, JSON file will be downloaded from figma.

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... üòÜ


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.name: Color AutoUpdater
plugins.description:
üöÄ Color AutoUpdater is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly keeping your design colors in check! Say goodbye to manually updating frame backgrounds and hello to automation.


‚ú® What it does:


üîç Scans all frames on the current page for text nodes with valid hex color codes.

üé® Updates frame backgrounds to match the detected hex color code.

üåì Ensures text readability by switching text to white on dark backgrounds and black on light backgrounds.

üßº Sets default colors (white background, black text) for frames without a color code, ensuring a clean and consistent look.


üõ†Ô∏è How to use it:


Select the Page: Open your Figma file and navigate to the page you want to update.

Automatic Update: The plugin scans all frames on the page and updates background colors based on the hex codes found in text nodes.

Review Changes: Frames with valid hex codes will have their backgrounds updated and text colors adjusted. Frames without hex codes will have a default white background and black text.


‚ö†Ô∏è Relevant limitations:


The plugin supports only 6-character hex color codes (e.g., #FFFFFF).

It works on the current page only, so run it separately for each page in your Figma file.

Frames without color codes will be set to a white background and black text, which might override custom defaults set by the user.

üí° With Color AutoUpdater, maintain a polished and consistent design effortlessly, saving you time and ensuring color accuracy and readability. Try it now and elevate your design workflow! üåü
plugins.tagline: update frame background colors based on color codes

plugins.name: Tuned Variables
plugins.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


üî• Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


üöÄ How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


üöß Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


üéÅ Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


ü§ù License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


üíé Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
plugins.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

plugins.name: Perceptually Uniform Gradients
plugins.description:
By default, Figma can generate some gradients that get really muddy as they transition from color to color. With this plugin you can generate gradients using color models which handle interpolation better, which translates to more beautiful gradients.


Features:

  1. Generate gradients in Lab, OKLCH, or LCH and insert them into your Figma files as a continuous gradient or as individual, evenly-spaced stops
  2. Extract key colors from your current selection
  3. Copy raw text color scales out of the plugin in JSON format
  4. Generate multi-hue gradients
  5. Automatically correct the lightness distributions of your gradients
  6. Generate bezier-curved gradients in the Lab color space
  7. Adjust the gamma distribution of your gradients
  8. Select colors from a curated library of options
  9. Drag and drop to reorder colors
plugins.tagline: Generate more beautiful gradients by interpolating them with perceptually uniform color models.

plugins.name: Utopia Spacers
plugins.description:
The Utopia Spacers plugin uses the Utopia Fluid Space Calculator to generate a variable collection of number variables across a variety of comp size modes.


How to Use

  1. Visit Utopia.fyi and create a system of spacers using their fluid space calculator linked above.
  2. By default, spacers are only shown at their min and max size. To use this plugin, add one or more custom viewport sized by clicking the black + in the top right of the calculator's calculated values (see images).
  3. Once you're happy with your system, copy and paste the URL into the plugin. A new set of variables called "Utopia Spacers" will generate in your Local Variables.
  4. Use the spacers as normal variables. If you need to update values or add sizes, you can update the calculator and copy/paste the new, updated URL to bring in your changes.


Tips

  • Make sure the first viewport you enter is the size you'll be designing in (we use 1440px).
  • If you have a Starter Figma account, you're limited to only 1 mode. If you have a Professional or Organization level account you can use up to 4 modes. Enterprise accounts can use up to 40 modes.
  • We use 390px for mobile, 768 for tablet, 1440 for desktop, and 2560 for XL desktop.
  • Make sure to save your most-current Utopia URL somewhere so you can reference it easily.

accepted.name: Kylie LaCour
accepted.description: Enthusiast of elegant digital systems, dedicated advocate of fluid responsive design, and novice creator of plugins.

plugins.tagline: Generate a variable collection of fluid responsive spacers based on the Utopia.fyi design system.

plugins.name: Base64 Encoder
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that streamlines the process of using SVGs in web projects by automating the export, optimisation, and conversion to base64-encoded data URIs for both CSS and HTML.


Overview

If you've ever needed to embed SVGs directly in your code, you know the process can be tedious:


  1. Export the SVG from Figma
  2. Optimise it with a tool like SVGO
  3. Convert it to base64
  4. Format it properly for CSS or HTML


This plugin automates the entire workflow with a single click. Select any frame or element in Figma and instantly copy optimised, base64-encoded SVGs ready to use as:


HTML <img> tags

CSS background-image properties

CSS mask-image properties (with customisable colours)


When to Use Base64-Encoded SVGs


Base64-encoded SVGs are particularly useful for:


  1. Email templates where external images may be blocked or filtered
  2. CSS backgrounds and decorative elements when you want to avoid additional HTTP requests
  3. Custom list markers that need to maintain consistency across email clients
  4. Icon systems where you need a small number of icons without the overhead of an icon font
  5. Mask images in CSS when you need a shape with a customisable fill colour
  6. Offline applications or environments with limited connectivity
  7. Performance optimisation for small, frequently used graphics


In these scenarios, embedding SVGs directly in your code eliminates HTTP requests, avoids CORS issues, and ensures visual elements display correctly regardless of external resource availability.
plugins.tagline: Instantly export, optimise, and convert SVGs to base64 for CSS and HTML üöÄ

plugins.name: ComfyUI-Image-Generator-Advance
plugins.description:
ComfyUI Image Generator Advance

Seamlessly Integrate Any ComfyUI Workflow

Powered by Comfy Deploy, this plugin bridges Figma with limitless AI workflows. Unleash unparalleled freedom to connect Figma and AI‚Äîcustomize, innovate, and create without boundaries!


---


Features

Unlock ComfyUI‚Äôs Full Potential:

Every feature ComfyUI offers is at your fingertips. If you can build it in ComfyUI, you can integrate it with Figma for AI-powered image generation!

Endless Customization:

Turn complex workflows into streamlined Figma actions.


---


Quick Start Guide

  1. Registeron: deploy.comfyui.asia
  2. Install the comfyui-deploy plugin in ComfyUI and configure your workflow . see tutorial.
  3. Deploy your workflow on deploy.comfyui.asia , configure GPU settings (you can use your own GPU), and obtain your API key.
  4. Launch the ComfyUI Image Generator Advance plugin in Figma, enter your API key, and start generating‚Äîyour custom workflow parameters will auto-load!


FAQ


Q: Is this plugin free?

A: We offer affordable paid plans to cover server costs and future upgrades. Your support keeps the innovation alive! üí°


Q: Why are generated images downscaled?

A: To ensure smooth data transfer and avoid bottlenecks, images are temporarily resized to a max of 1536 px on the longest edge. For full resolution, use upscaling workflows after initial processing.


Q: Why do requests sometimes fail?

A: ComfyUI‚Äôs API is still evolving. Check your browser console for errors, refresh the plugin, or retry the task. Ensure stable internet‚Äî**VPN required for users in mainland China**.


Q: Are servers located in China?

A: No. Due to AI regulations and licensing complexities, servers are hosted overseas. Users in China may experience slight latency; a stable VPN connection is recommended.


---


Full Documentation** ‚Üí Get Started

Explore More‚Üí Visit Our Official Site


---


Why Choose Us?

  1. Flexible Workflows: Your creativity, your rules.
  2. Global Scalability: Cloud-powered performance, wherever you are.
  3. Pro-Level Control: Perfect for designers and developers alike.

plugins.name: ChromaCraft
plugins.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. Based on this analysis, it generates a new color that is either darker or lighter and creates a visual representation of this new color beside the selected element. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.
